comments.creator: josh@joshtriplett.org
comments.author: josh@joshtriplett.org
comments.text:
Saving a complete webpage will include all videos embedded in <video> tags.  This can take a long time to download and use a lot of space.  For instance, saving Planet Mozilla right now took 342MB, of which 337MB consisted of videos (.webm, .mp4, .ogv).

I'd suggest that the Save dialog should have two separate checkboxes (or possibly one three-choice radio button), for "Include images and page styles" and "Include videos".  (Bonus if the latter only shows up when the page has videos.)
comments.raw_text:

I'd suggest that the Save dialog should have two separate checkboxes (or possibly one three-choice radio button), for "Include images and page styles" and "Include videos".  (Bonus if the latter only shows up when the page has videos.)

comments.raw_text: in iceweasel  - debian's firefox , 10.0.12 , i can stop and restart saving process, and it saves without video.
